text: John Bennett Fenn (June 15, 1917December 10, 2010) was an American analytical chemist. He was awarded a share of the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2002. Fenn shared half of the award with Koichi Tanaka for their work in mass spectrometry. ==References== Category:1917 births Category:2010 deaths Category:American chemists Category:Scientists from New York City
title: John B. Fenn
